meanings.definition: Having leaf or floral decorations resembling the acanthus plant.
meanings.sent1: The acanthous patterns on the curtains added a touch of nature to the room.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted an acanthous design on the vase, making it look elegant.
meanings.sent3: The acanthous wallpaper made the room feel like a garden, but without the bugs.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed around her like acanthous vines, creating a graceful silhouette.
meanings.sent5: The acanthous carvings on the wooden frame made it stand out among the plain ones.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the acanthus plant.
meanings.sent1: The acanthous leaves were used in the traditional medicine of the region.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with acanthous plants, each one carefully tended.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her acanthous salad would make anyone feel like a Greek god.
meanings.sent4: The acanthous roots spread deep into the soil, anchoring the plant firmly.
meanings.sent5: The acanthous aroma of the flowers filled the air with a sweet fragrance.

meanings.definition: Resembling the acanthus plant in form or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The acanthous columns of the building gave it a classical and majestic look.
meanings.sent2: The acanthous carvings on the furniture were intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator tried to make the frosting look acanthous, but it ended up looking spiky.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in an acanthous bun, inspired by ancient Greek sculptures.
meanings.sent5: The acanthous shadows of the trees danced on the ground in the afternoon sun.
